npcs.name: Sister Elarra
dialogue: Welcome, brave heroes. From the gossip that's reached my ears, you've caused quite the stir in this district already.
I am Sister Elarra, of the Ashen Chapel. Though our temple has seen better days, it still serves to Forge community. And today, it seems, rebellion.
Please, be sure to visit the shrine to heal your wounds.
And our forges burn hot. Let me help with your equipment. It's the least I can do for our champions.

npcs.name: Dante
dialogue: The Hushed Choir and the Ledgermen won't sit idle after the pain we've dealt them.
But as you can see, many folks from Sparkworks are ready to take up arms alongside you.
I have a lead on some old smuggling tunnels we can use to move about the district a little better, and really hit them where it hurts!

npcs.name: Old Brewer
dialogue: These damn Ledgermen. Always sitcking their nose in our district.
Sparkworks finally got some fight in it again. Saw a constable strung up from a lamppost yesterday. Can't say I shed any tears.

npcs.name: Zeke
dialogue: You're really here! I told everyone what you did taking out those Ledgermen out on the street!
The whole district's talking about it. They say you killed their mage and everything!
Sister Elarra says I did good spreading the word. Says I 'lit a spark.'

npcs.name: Chapel Guard
dialogue: I'm no soldier—just an old mushroom farmer. Then I saw Arden (and his jawline...). I knew it was time to stand tall, for my boys.
The Ledgermen won't catch us off guard again. Neither will those masked cultists from the Hushed Choir.

npcs.name: Child
dialogue: Zeke says you fought a whole army! And one of you came back from the DEAD!
Is it true there's a big oak man who can talk to trees?

npcs.name: Refugee Woman
dialogue: I haven't seen this place so abuzz since the old days. We've got to keep this energy going.
Don't look at me like that. This district used to mean something. Those old Victorian homes on the cliff? My family built one of them.
If you can remind people what we were... what we could be again... it was worth every sacrifice today.

npcs.name: Child
dialogue: My papa went to the House of Respite to talk to the Stoutwaters about joining the resistance!
Mama says we have to be brave. I'm trying!

npcs.name: Young Guard
dialogue: My father says we've got to take up arms and stand together. Said we're the first line now.
I've been practicing all night. If those freaky cultists show up here, we'll be ready.

npcs.name: Grateful Refugee
dialogue: You gave us something we haven't had in years—hope.
That mysterious Dante's got a good eye for talent. When Inferno told us he'd found people who could help... well, I wasn't so sure.
Not anymore.

introCutscene.speaker: Narrator
introCutscene.text: You enter the Ashen Chapel, a place of refuge for the resistance.

introCutscene.speaker: Narrator
introCutscene.text: Sister Elarra should be somewhere inside...
